channel.title: Need Help with Getting Server Online
channel.description:
As you can see I am new, so please do not flame me for any future requests I may have. I have read the rules.
So to start, I have a source and a client that I have been coding. I have JDK1.6.0_23, Winrar, a No-IP account and a No-IP host (*******.no-ip.biz).[b] All I would like know is to get it online so people can join[/b]. I have read many guides explaining how to do this but none of them seem to have worked. So I will explain what I do.
First: I Run my server Second: I open my No-IP Duc 3.0, select the host I had set as my server IP (in the [b]server files [/b] under [b]client.)[/b] To my knowledge my server should be online, right? Well aparently not, I use the mopar server status checker and it reads that my server is offline.
If anyone could please tell me if I am missing anything or if I am doing something wrong, I would really appreciate it.
Extra Info: I am on a laptop with wireless internet so does portforwarding still apply to me? --It is a 317 Delta--

item.title: Need Help with Getting Server Online

@c_o_l_d wrote:

[quote=“run moneygod, post:10, topic:391514”][quote author=RiiPiiNFtW link=topic=488678.msg3572668#msg3572668 date=1303170312]
portforward.com
[/quote]

or i can do it relly fast :P[/quote]
PM me^^

Read full topic

item.title: Need Help with Getting Server Online
item.dc:creator: @jmk600 jmk600
item.description:
@jmk600 wrote:

You need to portforward.

If you have a linksys, I will get the link to a guide in a second.

If you have any others, please go to Www.Portforward.com and find your router and do what it says.

Hope I helped.

Read full topic

item.title: Need Help with Getting Server Online
item.dc:creator: @c_o_l_d c o l d
item.description:
@c_o_l_d wrote:

As you can see I am new, so please do not flame me for any future requests I may have. I have read the rules.

So to start, I have a source and a client that I have been coding. I have JDK1.6.0_23, Winrar, a No-IP account and a No-IP host (*******.no-ip.biz). All I would like know is to get it online so people can join. I have read many guides explaining how to do this but none of them seem to have worked. So I will explain what I do.

First: I Run my server
Second: I open my No-IP Duc 3.0, select the host I had set as my server IP (in the server files under client.)
To my knowledge my server should be online, right?
Well aparently not, I use the mopar server status checker and it reads that my server is offline.

If anyone could please tell me if I am missing anything or if I am doing something wrong, I would really appreciate it.

Extra Info: I am on a laptop with wireless internet so does portforwarding still apply to me?
–It is a 317 Delta–

Read full topic
